index.head: CHECK YOUR UNDERSTANDING
index.screenText:
Select the appropriate options.
Q11. A bacterial culture follows the growth equation y = 3(1.9)x where y is the number of bacteria after x seconds. Which of the following graphs represents the growth curve? What is the number of bacteria at the start? What is the rate constant?

options.option: <font face="calibribold" size='3.1'>graph a, y = 3 at time x = 0, k = 1 s<sup>-1</sup> </font>
<font face="calibribold" size='3.1'>graph b, y = 2 at time x = 0, k = -1 s<sup>-1</sup></font>
<font face="calibribold" size='3.1'>graph c, y = 3 at time x = 0, k = 1 s<sup>-1</sup></font>
<font face="calibribold" size='3.1'>graph d, y = -3 at time x = 0, k = -1 s<sup>-1</sup></font>
<font face="calibribold" size='3.1'>graph c, y = 3 at time x = 0, k = 2 s<sup>-1</sup></font>

index.FeedbackIncorrect:
Not Quite!

The Correct Answer is: Option A

Read the explanation below to clear your understanding.
At x = 0, y = 3(1.9)x => y = 3(1.9)0 = 3. The graph A also shows this. The coefficient of x in the equation is 1. So k = 1.
index.FeedbackCorrect:
That's Correct

The Answer is: Option A

Read the explanation below to validate your answer.
At x = 0, y = 3(1.9)x => y = 3(1.9)0 = 3. The graph A also shows this. The coefficient of x in the equation is 1. So k = 1.
